meanings.sent1: The plaps of the door closing startled me.
meanings.sent2: I heard a plaps coming from the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The plaps of the balloon popping made everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: The plaps of raindrops on the roof sounded like tiny drums.
meanings.sent5: The plaps of the hammer hitting the nail echoed in the room.

meanings.definition: To make a sudden, sharp sound.
meanings.sent1: The toy gun plaps when you pull the trigger.
meanings.sent2: The branches plaps against the window during the storm.
meanings.sent3: The popcorn plaps loudly in the microwave.
meanings.sent4: Her heels plaps on the pavement as she walked quickly.
meanings.sent5: The stone plaps into the water, creating ripples.

meanings.definition: The act of making a sudden, sharp sound.
meanings.sent1: The sudden plaps of thunder made the dog bark.
meanings.sent2: His plaps echoed through the quiet library.
meanings.sent3: The plaps of the drumsticks on the drum created a rhythmic beat.
meanings.sent4: The plaps of the typewriter keys filled the room with noise.
meanings.sent5: The plaps of the car horn startled the pedestrians.
